resources.string: Waist - Measured slightly below the navel
Hips/Seat - Measured approximately 6” below the waist
Rise - The difference between the outseam and the inseam
Length, Neck to Waist - Measured down the spine
Inseam - Measured from crotch to floor, on the inside of the leg
Outseam - Measured on the side from waist to floor, on the outside of the leg
Front Width - Taken across from arm crease to arm crease
High Bust - Taken around the body above the bust and high under the arms
Bust (chest) - Measured at the nipple line
Full Front Width - Taken side seam to side seam across full bust
Waist - Measured at the narrowest point
High Hip - Usually 3”-3 ½” below waist at fullest part of tummy
Hips - Measured at the broadest (largest) point
Thigh - Fullest part of upper leg
Length (neck to waist) - Measured down the spine
Length (waist to desired finished distance from floor) - Measured down the spine
Inseam - Measured from the crotch to desired finished distance from floor
Crotch Depth - Measured seated, on the side, from seat to waist
Armscye Depth - the opening for your arm
Shoulder Elbow - Taken with arm bent and hand resting between waist and hip
Bicep - Fullest part of upper arm
Wrist - Taken around prominent wrist bone
Back Waist Length - Taken from prominent bone at base of neck to waist
Cross Back Width - Taken approximately 4” below base of neck across back from armhole to armhole
Full Back Width - Taken across back from side seam to side seam
Waist to knee (hem) - Lengths will vary according to styles
